title: How long does it take to write a 500 page novel? - Quora

response.answer_text: For the sake of a baseline, let’s assume the following: You type 40 words per minuteYou are financially independent and have no need to spend 8–12 hours per day struggling to stay on the right side of debt-slavery.A standard manuscript page is 250 words.A 500 page manuscript is 125,000 words.So: 40wpm x 60 minutes per hour x 8 hours per day = 19,200 words per day. 125,000 words / 19200 words per day = 6.510416666666667 days. About a week. Of course, it’s unlikely that’s a good novel…. The point is, it takes as long as you have time, discipline, and energy to work on it. I’ve “won” NaNoWriMo by writing a ~75000 word novel in 30 days. I’ve written two other novels in 90 days. Recently, I wrote a 65k novel in about 2 weeks. I made the time, planned how many words I needed to write each day and each hour of the time I gave myself to reach the overall goal I set for myself. I didn’t wait for inspiration to strike. I sat down and worked at it. You can too.

Wow! A great question? Wish I had a great answer. On the quick side, I guess a fast writer could produce 1,000 words a day. Meaning you could finish a first draft in 6 months given some down time. That doesn’t account for planning, research, editing and rewriting. So maybe a clean draft in a year. I’d still say that would be fast. My first novel took about a year and a half for 350 pages. My second was serialized once a week for a year (a great experience for a writer). My third, a Vietnam War novel, took some 30 years of on and off writing, throwing drafts out and revising, etc. The final draft, 550 pages, took 2 years. I’d guess an average of three years for 500 pages for a final draft. My second Vietnam War novel took about 2 1/2 years for 500 pages. Others may have had very different experiences.
